security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown text. No executable code, file operations, network calls, or command execution. Static findings are false positives caused by the scanner misinterpreting JSON source_url fields and markdown code block formatting as actual code patterns. All 29 reported findings can be dismissed.

content.value_statement: AI agents often claim success without actual verification. This skill prevents false completion claims by requiring fresh verification commands and evidence before any success assertion. It enforces discipline to run actual tests, show exit codes, and document proof.
actual_capabilities: Identifies appropriate verification commands for each claim type
Requires running fresh commands with full output capture
Validates exit codes and pass/fail counts before completion
Documents evidence in structured verification format
limitations: Does not execute verification commands itself
Does not integrate with specific CI/CD systems
Requires user or AI agent to run commands manually
Applies only to AI agent workflow discipline

use_cases.title: Prevent false test completion
use_cases.description: Never claim tests pass without showing fresh test output and exit codes as evidence

use_cases.title: Verify before QA sign-off
use_cases.description: Require full build and lint verification before marking development tasks complete

use_cases.title: Add verification discipline
use_cases.description: Prevent AI agents from claiming completion without actual verification evidence

prompt_templates.title: Verify tests pass
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the full test suite with fresh output. Show the exit code, count of passed and failed tests. Only claim 'tests pass' if exit code is 0 with 0 failures.

prompt_templates.title: Verify build succeeds
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the build command and capture full output. Show any errors and confirm artifacts were created. Quote the relevant output as evidence.

prompt_templates.title: Verify lint clean
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the linter and show the output with problem count. Claim 'no lint errors' only if 0 problems were found.

prompt_templates.title: Flow exit gate
prompt_templates.prompt: Identify all required verification commands for this flow stage. Run each one fresh, capture full output, verify success criteria, and document evidence before proceeding.

output: Output Summary: 42 tests passed, 0 failed, 85% coverage
Conclusion: All tests pass. Ready for commit.

best_practices: Always run verification commands fresh without relying on cached or previous results
Show the actual command output with exit codes as evidence, not just beliefs
Apply the same verification standard regardless of change size or complexity
anti_patterns: Claiming 'tests pass' without running the test suite or showing output
Skipping verification 'just this once' for seemingly trivial changes
Trusting that 'CI will catch it' instead of verifying locally first

faq.question: Which AI tools are supported?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Works as a prompt-based discipline guide.

faq.question: Does this skill run commands automatically?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides guidelines for when and how to run verification. The AI agent must execute commands.

faq.question: Can I customize verification commands?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill provides common examples. Replace with project-specific commands like pytest, go test, or maven.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-only skill with no code execution, file access, or network calls. It only provides workflow guidance.

faq.question: What if verification fails?
faq.answer: The skill requires showing the failure evidence. Fix the issues and re-run verification until all criteria pass.

faq.question: How does this compare to other verification tools?
faq.answer: Unlike automated testing tools, this skill enforces behavioral discipline in AI agents before claiming completion.
